CatDescriptText: Mrs. Yvonne Wright, housewife, 1845 Cliff Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 24, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that President Eisenhower should invoke the Taft-Hartley Act in steel strike?" answer reads: "In a way, yes, and in a way, no. There are some steelworkers who want to return to work, and there are a lot of others who do not want to return under Taft-Hartley.  I think that it would be the right thing for the President to do if he invokes the Taft-Hartley law, because if the steel strike continues, it will put everybody out of work."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Yvonne Wright wearing light colored coat, holding paper bags and floral change purse, posed in front of Beck Shoes, Fifth Avenue, Downtown
